item.description:
Taoist Healing Arts Fair

Join us for this special one-day event
to celebrate the Taoist healing arts!  

  • Celebrate Asian New Year ~ Year of the Dragon 2012!
  • Hourly workshop presentations & book signings
  • Over 30 exhibitors and information tables
  • Tai Chi, Qi Gong & Martial Arts demonstrations
  • Massage & auricular therapy healing sessions
  • Tea tasting & ceremony with Lotus Leaf Tea
  • Traditional Chinese music & dance performances
  • Local art exhibition, "Entering Into Stillness"
  • Validated parking, discount coupons & raffle prizes

 

Sunday January 29th, 2012  from 2 to 8 pm 

$30 at the door  ~  $20-25 online registration...
To register: http://wuhealing.com/node/10149

 

Hourly Workshops with...

Eunmi Han ..
Change Your Breath, Change Your Health

Master Hyunmoon Kim ..
Natural Breathing: The Taoist Way of Enlightenment 

Dr. Ming Wu ..
Tui Na Massage for the Family

Erik Harris ..
Qi Gong for Healthy Weight Loss

Laura Mignosa ..
Common Cures & Chinese Herbs

Lisl Meredith ..
The Tao of Diet: Restorative Nutrition

 

Exhibits & Demonstrations
The Art of Feng Shui, Chi & Movement, Chinese Kung Fu, Chen Tai Chi, Tibetan Singing Bowls, Taoist Yoga, YangTai Chi, Reiki, Massage Therapy ...and many more!

Chinese New Year Dances by the Asian Performing Arts Group!

   
Sponsors & Exhibitor Information
One 3 x 8 table and two chairs provided upon receipt of $50 registration fee with application. When reserving your space, please let us know if you’d like to give a demonstration. Sponsors and exhibitors should arrive by 1:20 pm to set up.

To reserve an exhibit space, download an application form:
http://sundo.org/media/flyers/Exhibitor%20Application.pdf

Contact us: 1.800.990.9332 or 860.523.5260
Visit www.sundo.org/events for more details.

 

"Breath is the movement of Spirit in the body... There is no single more powerful way to further your well-being than breathwork." 
  ~  Andrew Weil, M.D.
item.how_to_find_us: Validated parking in town hall lot, Enter through main auditorium doors
item.name: Taoist Healing Arts Fair
